page.title: 18Enterprise Centre
page.content: Part of the old railway works at Newtown is being developed as a place for small businesses. These are 93 plots and building units available and 12 are being used upto date. There is a plaque on the wall which says it was opened on 24th. May, 1985, by Lord Aldington. Some of the businesses are in the old railway workshops. The sorts of businesses are: fencing, car repairs, road haulage, sign writing, office cleaning and paving. Some have arrived from other premises. Adams Fencing moved here from Kennington in February, 1985. Redwyn Signwriters who paint boards and vehicles came in March T.C.T.Road Haulage have 5 tipper lorries and deliver loads like shingle, sand and cement throughout Kent and Sussex. There is also a driving school and a carpet shop.
